trans-unit.source: An abstract class used as a base class for other formatters, (for example, <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10ItemFormatter"></xref>).
This class is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref> class.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> must have a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> associated with it.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> can then write out the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The only way to associate a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> is by using this constructor.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> to write.
Verifies whether the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> contains a valid syndication item.
An XML reader to check.
`true`, if the XML reader contains a valid syndication item, otherwise `false`.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.

The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance used to create it.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> used to create the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class.

The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> instance used to create it.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> class.
The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance used to create it.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> to use to create the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.

The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance used to create it.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance used to create the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> associated with the formatter.

A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> by passing in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> constructor.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> associated with the formatter.

Loads element extensions into the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and maximum extension size.
The RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications allow you to add custom element extensions to a syndication feed.
This method allows you to read in these element extensions from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> to load the element extensions into.
The maximum allowable size for an element extension (in bytes).
Invalid XML encountered during read.

Loads element extensions into the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and maximum extension size.
The RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications allow you to add custom element extensions to a syndication feed.
This method allows you to read in these element extensions from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> to load the element extensions into.
The maximum allowable size for an element extension (in bytes).

Loads element extensions into the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and maximum extension size.
The RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications allow you to add custom element extensions to a syndication feed.
This method allows you to read in these element extensions from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> to load the element extensions into.
The maximum allowable size for an element extension (in bytes).

Loads element extensions into the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and maximum extension size.
The RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications allow you to add custom element extensions to a syndication feed.
This method allows you to read in these element extensions from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> to load the element extensions into.
The maximum allowable size for an element extension (in bytes).
Reads in a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.

Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>, associates it with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> and reads the feed into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
Associates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref>.
This method is protected and cannot be called from user code.

To associate a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter>, either create a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> instance and pass the constructor a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance or load a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter.ReadFrom%28System.Xml.XmlReader%29>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> to associate with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref>.
Gets a string representation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter"></xref> instance.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.

To control how attribute extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson.TryParseAttribute%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the attribute was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.

To control how attribute extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink.TryParseAttribute%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the attribute was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.

To control how attribute extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.TryParseAttribute%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the attribute was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.

To control how attribute extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.TryParseAttribute%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the attribute was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse syndication item content using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.

To control how syndication content is parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.TryParseContent%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent%40%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to use.
The content type.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
The content to parse.
A value that indicates whether the content was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an element extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.

To control how element extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.TryParseElement%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the element was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an element extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.

To control how element extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.TryParseElement%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the element was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an element extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.

To control how element extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink.TryParseElement%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the element was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an element extension using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.

To control how element extensions are parsed, derive your own class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson.TryParseElement%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance to use.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that indicates whether the element was parsed successfully.
Gets the syndication version of the formatter.
[!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] supports the RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications.
The syndication version of the formatter.

Writes the attribute extensions in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in the specified syndication version.

To control how attribute extensions are written by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory>, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.WriteAttributeExtensions%28System.Xml.XmlWriter%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write the extensions to.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance that contains the attribute extensions to be written.
The syndication version to write the attribute extensions in.

Writes the attribute extensions in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in the specified syndication version.

To control how attribute extensions are written by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.WriteAttributeExtensions%28System.Xml.XmlWriter%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write the extensions to.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance that contains the attribute extensions to be written.
The syndication version to write the attribute extensions in.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance that contains the attribute extensions to be written.
The syndication version to write the attribute extensions in.

To control how attribute extensions are written by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson>, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.WriteAttributeExtensions%28System.Xml.XmlWriter%2CSystem.String%29> method.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance that contains the attribute extensions to be written.

Writes the element extensions in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in the specified syndication version.

To control how element extensions are written by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory>, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.WriteElementExtensions%28System.Xml.XmlWriter%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write the extensions to.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance that contains the element extensions to be written.
The syndication version the extensions are written in.

Writes the element extensions in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in the specified syndication version.
